testcase.summary: Verify that the intro pages exist for the student take exam in ev7.
testcase.preconditions: :An exam and student must be created.

step.actions: Alter the following fields in the DB or via an ev6 input:Exam Name Exam availability (when it is open / closed for taking) Time limit of the exam (if applicable) Number of takes (one or infinite) Exam Introduction / instructions
step.expectedresults: Verify through the UI that the intro page correctly reflects these values. There should be an intro page with the following: Exam Name Exam availability (when it is open / closed for taking) Time limit of the exam (if applicable) Number of takes (one or infinite) Exam Introduction / instructions Begin Exam button The user will be taken to the second intro page with another Begin Exam button and some hardcoded verbiage around taking exams. (This will be done after the July release. Currently clicking here takes the user into the exam - take side.)

testcase.summary: Verify the question page of an exam.
testcase.preconditions: :An exam and student must be created.

step.actions: Access an exam as a student and click on the 'Begin Exam' button.
step.expectedresults: The student will be taken into the exam. Verify the following: - The section (page) title will be at the top. (future release) - One of each of the 7 question types will exist. - There will be a Save button and a Submit button at the top and bottom of the screens.User Acceptance Criteria: - Question Text Displayed - Multiple Distractors Displayed, if applicable (ex: T/F or MC) - Ability to choose one choice from the distractors (if applicable) or ability to enter text into the answer box (if applicable) The questions should be able to be answered.

testcase.summary: This test is intended to do negative testing on the student take page for each question type.
testcase.preconditions: :An exam and student must be created.

step.actions: As a prof setup the exam so that the questions are not in "default" order, i.e., beginning with T/F and ending with Essay. Put the questions in random order.Access an exam as a student and click on the 'Begin Exam' button.
step.expectedresults: The student will be taken to the exam questions page. The question order will match the professor's setup. Boundary Test:The correct of characters should be displayed.Special Characters Test:The characters should be displayed correctly. Boundary Test:The correct of characters should be displayed.Special Characters Test:The characters should be displayed correctly.

testcase.summary: Verify that the intro pages exist for the student take exam in ev7.
testcase.preconditions: :An exam and student must be created.

step.actions: Access an ev7 exam.
step.expectedresults: There should be an intro page with the following:Exam Name Exam availability (when it is open / closed for taking) Exam review date (if applicable) Time limit of the exam (if applicable) Number of takes (one or infinite) Exam Introduction / instructions Begin Exam button Boundary Test:The correct of characters should be displayed.Special Characters Test:The characters should be displayed correctly. Boundary Test:The correct of characters should be displayed.Special Characters Test:The characters should be displayed correctly. No dates available should have a message to that effect.

testcase.summary: Verify that after exiting the exam, when the student clicks on the exam content item, he will see the simple results page that was displayed after the student originally submitted.
testcase.preconditions: :An exam and student must be created.

step.actions: Access an exam with an exam title as a student and click on the 'Begin Exam' button.Notes: don't confuse the exam title with the content item title. Exam title is created in the Title & Introductory Text section.
step.expectedresults: The student will be taken into the exam. You should be able to answer the questions without error. 1. The answers should be submitted.2. The result/grade summary page should be displayed. (Make a note of the data on the summary page.) The result summary should be displayed again. Verify the following: - The exam name exists & is correct. - The time when the exam was taken. - The duration of the time spent in the exam. - The percentage scores. - Number of points out of total points. - Points Possible.This summary page will match the post-take exam summary page.

testcase.summary: Verify that simple results with scores are presented to the student after submitting the exam.
testcase.preconditions: :An exam and student must be created.

step.actions: Access an exam with an exam title as a student and click on the 'Begin Exam' button.Notes: don't confuse the exam title with the content item title. Exam title is created in the Title & Introductory Text section.
step.expectedresults: The student will be taken into the exam. You should be able to answer the questions without error. The result summary should be displayed again. Verify the following: - The exam name exists & is correct. - The time when the exam was taken. - The duration of the time spent in the exam. - The percentage scores. - Number of points out of total points. - Point Possible.

testcase.summary: This test is to verify the manual save functionality during Take Exam for a student.
testcase.preconditions: :There must be an exam and student created.

step.actions: Open Fiddler or Firebug.
step.expectedresults: You will be monitoring calls made during this test. The student will be taken to the Exam Take screen. The answers will be saved without error.A confirmation message will be given that states: "Your answers have been saved, but not yet submitted for grading. To submit your answers for grading, click Save & Submit." (Use the mouse cursor to OK out of this message.)Verification: - Ensure via Fiddler or Firebug that the call is made. - Verify in the DB that the answers are saved. (This will be in the Exam Staging DB since the exam has not yet been submitted.)Note: The query is: "SELECT * FROM dbo.StudentQuestionHeader WHERE StudentID = xxxxxxx AND ExamPkID = xxxxxx"The ExamPkID can be found in Fiddler when the student enters the exam or when the questions are saved. The answers will be saved without error.A confirmation message will be given that states: "Your answers have been saved, but not yet submitted for grading. To submit your answers for grading, click Save & Submit." (Use Enter to OK out of this message.)Verification: - Ensure via Fiddler or Firebug that the call is made. - Verify in the DB that the answers are saved. (This will be in the Exam Staging DB since the exam has not yet been submitted.) The answers will be saved without error.A confirmation message will be given that states: "Your answers have been saved, but not yet submitted for grading. To submit your answers for grading, click Save & Submit." (Use the mouse cursor to select X on the window to exit out of this message.)Verification: - Ensure via Fiddler or Firebug that the call is made. - Verify in the DB that all questions now have answers. (This will be in the Exam Staging DB since the exam has not yet been submitted.)

testcase.summary: This test is intended to do negative testing on the manual Save Answers functionality.
testcase.preconditions: :A student and an exam must already be created.

step.actions: Open Fiddler or Firebug.
step.expectedresults: You will be monitoring calls made during this test. The student will be taken to the Exam Take screen. A confirmation message will be given that states: "Your answers have been saved."Verification: - Ensure via Fiddler or Firebug that the call is made. - Verify in the DB that the exam is visible (it isn't visible if no answers have been saved).There will be no answers, the nAnswer column will have values of -1, and IsCorrect will be 0.(This will be in the Exam Staging DB since the exam has not yet been submitted.)Note: The ExamPkID can be found in Fiddler when first entering an exam or when saving answers.

testcase.summary: This test is to verify the auto-save functionality during Take Exam for a student.
testcase.preconditions: :There must be an exam and student created.

step.actions: Open Fiddler or Firebug.
step.expectedresults: You will be monitoring calls made during this test. The student will be taken to the Exam Take screen. Verify that a "save" call is made upon selecting an answer.Also verify in the Exam Staging DB that the answer has been saved. Verify that a "save" call is made upon changing the answer.Also verify in the Exam Staging DB that the answer has been changed.

testcase.summary: This test is to verify the Submit functionality during Take Exam for a student.
testcase.preconditions: :There must be an exam and a student created.

step.actions: Open Fiddler or Firebug.
step.expectedresults: You will be monitoring calls made during this test. The student will be taken to the Exam Take screen. A confirmation message will be given that states: "...." (Use the mouse cursor to OK out of this message.)Verification: - Ensure via Fiddler or Firebug that the call is made (endexam). - Verify in the DB that the answers that had been given are saved and moved from Exam Staging to the permanent exam DB. Also verify that the questions not answered are still blank in the DB. The student will be taken to the Exam Take screen. A confirmation message will be given that states: "...." (Use Tab and Enter to OK out of this message.)Verification: - Ensure via Fiddler or Firebug that the call is made. - Verify in the DB that the answers are saved and moved from Exam Staging to the permanent exam DB.

testcase.summary: This test is intended to do negative testing on the Submit Exam functionality.
testcase.preconditions: :There must be an exam and a student created.

step.actions: Login as a student and access an exam. Click on Begin Exam.
step.expectedresults: The student will be taken to the Exam Take screen. You will be monitoring calls made during this test. The student will be return to the exam, which will not be submitted.Verification: - Ensure via Fiddler or Firebug that the Submit call is NOT made. - Verify in the DB that the answers that had been given have not been moved from Exam Staging to the permanent exam DB. The student will be return to the exam, which will not be submitted.Verification: - Ensure via Fiddler or Firebug that the Submit call is NOT made. - Verify in the DB that the answers that had been given have not been moved from Exam Staging to the permanent exam DB.

testcase.summary: Verify that the initial Summary Page displays a message stating when the user can see his results -or- the objective score, depending on what options are chosen during exam setup.(Note: For Iteration 4 this will include all question types except for Matching, which will be added as another user story in Iteration 5.)
testcase.preconditions: :An exam with all 7 types of questions and student must be created.

step.actions: (Note: For Iteration 5, steps 1-4 can be skipped since that User Story has not yet been implemented.)Data Setup: - Create an exam with each question type. - Enter an Exam Title. (This is not to be confused with the content item name. This is available from the Author side of the exam through the Title & Introductory Text section.) - Do not select any options under "Results Features", e.g., we will not be selecting the Objective Score. (Unselect any chosen by default.) - Make a note of the correct answers and points per question. (The best way to do this is to compare to the Author side in different browser type than the student uses to take the exam.)
step.expectedresults: The student can now login and take the exam. The student will be taken into the exam.The time the exam was started will be verified in a future step. You should be able to answer the questions without error. A basic Summary Screen will be available. - The exam name exists & is correct. - The date that the exam was taken. - The duration of the time spent in the exam. - There will be no objective score. - There will be a message stating that the score will be available on a future date (uses Review Date from the exam scheduler). The student can now login and take the exam. The grade detail page should be displayed. Verify the following: - The exam name exists & is correct. - The date that the exam was taken. - The duration of the time spent in the exam. - The percentage score. - Number of points out of total points.Please note: For Iteration 5, Matching question types will not be included in the summary page. For this objective test (which doesn't include the questions in the summary anyway) this may only affect the total points and/or percentage.

testcase.summary: Verify that the Return to CI summary page displays a message stating when the user can see his results -or- the objective score, depending on what options are chosen during exam setup.(Note: For Iteration 4 this will include all question types except for Matching, which will be added as another user story in Iteration 5.)
testcase.preconditions: :The test case "EV7_Grade Summary_Student_Question Detail Page - Post-Take Exam - a - Objective Score" should've been run already.

step.actions: After taking an exam as a student (done in the test case "EV7_Grade Summary_Student_Question Detail Page - Post-Take Exam - a - Objective Score"), go back as that student and click on the same exam item.
step.expectedresults:
The exam content item should have a Summary page and the student will not have the ability to re-enter the exam.Verify the following: - The exam name exists & is correct. - The date the exam was taken. - The duration of the time spent in the exam. - The percentage scores. - Number of points out of total points.Please note: For Iteration 5 this will include all question types except for Matching, which will be added as a separate user story.
Professor is in the GB detail for the exam student taken. Comments for each question are saved.
The grade detail summary should be displayed. (All of the data will be the same as in the previous steps.)Verify the following: - The exam name exists & is correct. - The time when the exam was taken. - The duration of the time spent in the exam. - The percentage scores. - Number of points out of total points. - The professor comments should not display since only an objective score is currently being displayed.Please note: For Iteration 5 this will include all question types except for Matching, which will be added as a separate user story.

testcase.summary: Verify that when a student exits and returns to an unfinished single-take exam, the exam can be reloaded and previously saved answers are displayed correctly.
testcase.preconditions: :An exam with all 7 types of questions and student must be created.(Note: Currently this includes all question types except for Matching, which is still being implemented.)

step.actions: Data Setup:Create an exam with two of each question types currently supported. Set the exam as a single take without kickout.Use the default 60 minute timer.
step.expectedresults: Answer one of each question type.Save (do NOT submit). You have simulated the student inadvertently exiting out of the browser after saving the questions. The student will be taken into the exam. Verify the following: - The exam is loaded up without error. - The previously answered questions are displayed with the saved answers. - The timer does not start when the browser was closed, but rather accounts for the time that the user was out of the exam. (i.e., If you have 55 minutes left when you exit and you are out of the exam for 5 minutes you should have 50 minutes left when you return.) The changed answers should be saved and the user exited from the browser. The student will be taken into the exam. Verify the following: - The exam is loaded up without error. - The answers that were changed are displaying the new responses rather than the previously saved ones. The new answers should be saved and the user exited from the browser. The student will be taken into the exam. Verify the following: - The exam is loaded up without error. - The new answers are displaying correctly.

testcase.summary: Verify that the number of points is displayed for each question during the student is taking the exam.
testcase.preconditions: :An exam with all 7 types of questions and student must be created.Notes: matching question is scheduled for future iterations.

step.actions: Access an exam as a student and click on the 'Begin Exam' button.
step.expectedresults: The student will be taken into the exam. Verify the following: - For each type of question, the number of points is displayed to the right of question. The number of points for each question on the student take should match what's on the exambuilder.

testcase.summary: Verify that the timer can be displayed or hide during the student is taking the exam.
testcase.preconditions: :1. A single take exam and student must be created.2. Kick out option is not selected.

step.actions: Access a single take exam as a student and click on the 'Begin Exam' button.
step.expectedresults: The student will be taken into the exam. Verify the following: - A count down timer should be displayed at the upper right corner and the timer should start to come down once you enter the exam. - There should be button/link underneath the time. The button text should be display/hide. - By default, it should be "display". The timer should be hidden. The timer should reappear and time displayed should continue to count. The timer should continue to come down. The timer should be stopped at zero.

testcase.summary: Verify that the student is forced out of the exam when the time limit set for the exam is expired.
testcase.preconditions: :1. An exam and student user are created.2. The kick-out option is selected.

step.actions: Access the exam and click on the 'Begin Exam' button.
step.expectedresults: The student will be taken into the exam. 1. A message should display stating that the time is expired, and the answers will be saved and submitted. 2. The exam should kick the user out after saving and submitting the results of the user's exam. (Verify through the DB that the correct answers were saved.) Manual testers check that the answers were saved in teh display results page.3. The grade summary page should be displayed. 1.The student should get the message stating the exam has already been taken by the student.2. The grade summary results should be displayed.3. The student shouldn't be able to take the exam again.

testcase.summary: When the time limit is set to the 999 minute boundary (from the future auth side), verify that the timer converts this into hours/minutes, and starts the countdown correctly.
testcase.preconditions: :1. A single take exam and student should have been created.2. Set the time allowed to be 999 minutes if using the new auth UI (or 16 hours, 20 mins if using the old auth UI).

step.actions: Data Setup:As a professor, create a non-kick exam that is set up for 999 minutes (or 16 hrs and 40 mins if using the old auth page).
step.expectedresults: The exam is now ready for the student to take. The student will be taken into the exam. Verify the following: - A count down timer should be displayed at the upper right corner and the timer should start to count down once you enter the exam. - The start time for count down should be corrrect according to the "Time allowed."For example: 999 minutes should be converted into 16 hours and 39 minutes. The confirmation message window should pop up. 1. The submssion should be canceled.2. The timer should continue to count down. Verify that the time continued to count down even though it was hidden and the student had exited the exam.

testcase.summary: Verify that the student is not forced out of the exam if the exam is not set as a kickout and that the summary page correctly reflects the time spent in the exam.
testcase.preconditions: :1. An exam and student user are created.2. The kick-out option is not selected.Subject\TeachingSolutions\03 Teaching Solutions Manual Test Repository\13_Berlin\Assessments

step.actions: Test I - Data Setup:As a professor, create a 5-min exam that is NOT marked as kickout.
step.expectedresults: The exam is ready for the student to take. The student will be taken into the exam. The timer will stop counting down at the correct time. The user will not be kicked out of the exam. Verify the answers in the Summary page and in the DB. The changed answers will be saved and correctly reflected.Verify the timer in the Summary page displays the actual time spent in the exam (in this case 10 minutes) rather than just the five-minute time limit. The exam is ready for the student to take. The student will be taken into the exam. The timer will stop counting down at the correct time. The user will not be kicked out of the exam. The browser will be closed. (The exam will not be submitted.) The student will still be able to access the exam, even though the timer as stopped, since this is not a kick-out exam.The timer should remain at 00:00:00 since it is expired.

testcase.summary: Verify the display of the ability to see the configuration settings for scheduled start and end date for the exam.
testcase.preconditions: :A professor must be enrolled in the course and an exam created.

step.actions: Login as a professor. Go to the Manage side of an assessment and open the Schedule tab.Verify the following: - The scheduler has its own section (including Available from, to & Review Dates) on the 'Schedule' tab. - There is a field for "Available from:" followed by a field called "to:". - There will be no checkboxes around the date fields. - There will be calendar controls (date-pickers) after both "Available from" and "to". - "Available from" and "to" fields will be defaulted to the RealDB course start and end date. (Note: These are not necessarily the same dates as in Whittaker Admin pages or the MMND portal.) - Clicking on either of these dates fields will open the appropriate date picker. - When the user chooses a date/time from the "Available from" calendar control, this will be displayed in the "Available from" field. - When the user chooses a date/time from the "to" calendar control, this will be displayed in the "to" field.
step.expectedresults: The screen should look/behave as described.

testcase.summary: Verify the display of the ability to see the configuration settings for the results review date for the exam.
testcase.preconditions: :A professor must be enrolled in the course and an exam created.

step.actions: Enter the exam and access the Author side of an exam. Click on the "Schedule" tab.
step.expectedresults: The exam scheduler will be displayed. Verify the expected functionality.

testcase.summary: The purpose of this test is to verify that if an exam can contain several matching questions and that their answers are not interchangeable.
testcase.preconditions: :There must be a professor & student enrolled in the course and an exam created (part of data setup in the Steps of this test case).

step.actions: Data SetupAs a professor, create an exam with several (at least 3) Matching question types.
step.expectedresults: The exam is now ready for the student. The exam will open without errors and will load all Matching questions with the correct matching selections. The results of these will be verified later. You should not be allowed to drag the answers between questions. Verify that the answers switch places and no answer is left out. The answers will be returned to their original places in the answer list and the questions will have blank spaces for answers. Verify that the answers are retained.

step.expectedresults: The paging settings will be displayed (among other options). Verify the expected functionality.

Would you like to continue?". The user will be taken back to the take exam screen.The previously-selected answers will be cleared. The exam will be submitted successfully and the user will be once again taken to the Summary screen. - Subtract the time remaining from the hour given and verify that the time taken is correct. - Verify that the objective score is correct. (Compare the selected answers to the correct answers for total points and percentage.) Ensure that the score is not the same as the previous take since the answers chosen were different. - There will not be any questions/answers listed on this summary page. - There will still be a button on the Summary page titled "Retake". The student will now be viewing the Return to Item Summary screen (instead of the initial Summary screen that was just tested.)Verify the following: - The time taken is correct. - The objective score is correct. (This should reflect the second time the exam was taken.) - There will not be any questions/answers listed on this summary page. - There will still be a button on the Summary page titled "Retake". A message will be displayed stating: "If you continue, the results and score of your previous attempt will be overwritten. Would you like to continue?". The student will be returned to the Summary page. A message will be displayed stating: "If you continue, the results and score of your previous attempt will be overwritten. Would you like to continue?". The user will be taken back to the take exam screen.The previously-selected answers will be cleared. The exam will be submitted successfully and the user will be once again taken to the Summary screen. - Subtract the time remaining from the hour given and verify that the time taken is correct. - Verify that the objective score is correct. (Compare the selected answers to the correct answers for total points and percentage.) Ensure that the score is not the same as the previous take since the answers chosen were different. - There will not be any questions/answers listed on this summary page. - There will still be a button on the Summary page titled "Retake".

testcase.summary: This test is for a QA-only user story to verify whether matching questions/answers are truly being randomized. That question was brought up during iteration planning by QA so the US was created/assigned from there.
testcase.preconditions: :A professor and 2 students must be enrolled in the course.Summary:This test will cover a prof creating several (at lest 3) exams with the same exact matching questions in the same order.The student will then take the exams and gather screenshots.The screenshots will be used to compare the order of the Matching potential answers to see if they are just randomized once and displayed the same for each exam or whether they are randomized differently for each exam.

step.actions: Login as a professor and create several (at lest 3) exams with the same exact matching questions in the same order. (Hint: Using Test Banks will make this more accurate and save some time.)
step.expectedresults: The exams are now ready for the student to take. The student will now have the means to compare multiple takes of the same Matching question(s). You will now have the results of an ev7 student take. You will now have ev6 results for comparison.Report these results to the team to see if current functionality is acceptable.

testcase.summary: This test will verify that when a question is answered in take exam the exam progress summary number will increment. Additionally, when a question is cleared the summary number will decrement.
testcase.preconditions: :A multi-question exam must be created (outlined as Data Setup in the Design Steps) and a student enrolled in the course.

step.actions: Data SetupCreate an exam with at least one of each question type.
step.expectedresults: The exam is now ready for the student to take. The exam will open without error.At the bottom with be an indicator of the number of questions. It will state: "You have answered 0 of xx questions" where xx = the total number of questions in the exam. The number at the bottom will increase by one, i.e.:"You have answered 1 of xx questions". The number at the bottom will decrease by one, i.e.:"You have answered 0 of xx questions". All question types will increment up when answered.All question types will decrement down when cleared (where applicable).

testcase.summary: This test will verify that increment and decrement of the exam progress summary number works when the exam has over 100 questions i.e., the question number is into the triple digits. Also to be tested is verifying that the number count increments/decrements when the questions are not answered in order.
testcase.preconditions: :A multi-question exam must be created with over 100 questions (outlined as Data Setup in the Design Steps) and a student enrolled in the course.

step.actions: Data SetupCreate an exam with over 100 questions. Recommended is several questions over 100, e.g. 105.Include at least one of each question type.
step.expectedresults: The exam is now ready for the student to take. The exam will open without error.At the bottom with be an indicator of the number of questions. It will state: "You have answered 0 of xxx questions" where xxx = the total number of questions in the exam.It will correctly display how many questions are available to take, e.x.: "... of 105 questions". The number at the bottom should increment and decrement correctly even though the questions are not being answered in order. The number at the bottom will read 99 of xxx, ex: "You have answered 99 of 105 questions". The number at the bottom will increment to correly reflect that the number of questions answered is now in the triple-digits. Ex:: "You have answered 100 of 105 questions". The number at the bottom will decrease back to double digits.Ex: "You have answered 99 of 105 questions". All question types will increment up when answered, even to a total of all questions being answered, ex: "...105 of 105 questions". All question types will decrement down when cleared but will remain in the triple digits, as long as is applicable, without error.

If detailed result page is enabled all question results will be visible
Each section in the exam will be represented as a separate page, with links for the page number, and previous and next links. Each question in the exam will take up one page, there will be links for every other page, and previous next links to navigate between all the pages Each question will be associated with a section on the detailed result screen, and will be expandable collapsable

testcase.summary: This test will verify that increment and decrement of the exam progress summary number works when a user opts to re-take an exam. Because all questions are reset it is expected the count for all questions will reset as well
testcase.preconditions: :A multi-question exam must be created and set to allow student to retake the exam

step.expectedresults: Student will login successfully, "Take Exam Again" button will be present Pop up dialog will appear informing user that all answers will be cleared User will be taken to the exam intro screen with the following information available and correct:Exam Title (if one was entered for the exam)Exam Duration,Exam Allows Duration,Exam Allowed date range,Exam Intro Text (if one was entered for the exam) User will be taken to the exam, alll questions will have been cleared, exam progress count will be 0 answered, and questions avialable count will match total count of questions on the exam After all questions are answered the 2 counts will be the same

testcase.summary: This test will verify that increment and decrement of the exam progress summary number works with a special case for matching questions which can be reset manually or through a reset button that comes with each matching question
testcase.preconditions: :A multi-question exam must be created with at least 2 matching questions

step.actions: Login as a student and opt to take an exam that has at least 2 matching questions
step.expectedresults: User will successfully login and launch an exam Questions answered count will remain at 0 Questions answered count will not be affected by reset button if matching question hasn't been answered Answered question count will only decrement once for when the matching question is initially cleared Answered question count will decrement after all answers are manually cleared, it will not decrement again if the reset button is pressed Exam will be completed with no unexpected behavior

testcase.summary: Verify the ability of an assessments author to remove questions from the exam.
testcase.preconditions: :There must be a course with a professor and an exam created in that course.

step.actions: Data Setup:Create an exam with multiple questions in one section. Test should include one of each 7 question types. One point should be assigned for each question.
step.expectedresults: You are now ready to delete questions. All 7 existing questions will be listed on the page, under the schedule/configuration/introduction tab bar and under the 'Add Question' and 'Add Section' buttons (when implemented).There will be a total of 7 questions and 7 points. The tooltip/hover text will read: "Delete". (Or similar. If different, verify with Nate & Albert.) You will receive the following verification message:"Are you sure you want to delete this question?" OK / Cancel You will be returned to the Manage screen. There will be no confirmation message and the question will still be listed. You will receive the following verification message:"Are you sure you want to delete this question?" OK / Cancel You will be returned to the screen. There will be no confirmation message and the question will still be listed. - The user will be returned to the page and the deleted question will no longer be displayed. (Note: Deleted questions do not actually get removed from the DB.) - There will be a verification message at the top of the window "Your changes have been saved - The user will be returned to the page and the deleted question will no longer be displayed. (Note: Deleted questions do not actually get removed from the DB.) - There will be a verification message at the top of the window "Your changes have been saved Same results expected as the previous step: - The user will be returned to the page and the deleted question will no longer be displayed. (Note: Deleted questions do not actually get removed from the DB.) - There will be a verification message at the top of the window "Your changes have been saved" - See Albert's mocks (yellow message confirmation at top) Note: As of this writing the dev (Christa) indicated that this was using a dialog box across the board instead. Verify with Nate/Albert that this is OK. - The number of questions at the top will change to reflect 3 questions instead of 4. - The number of points updated to reflect deletions. - The order of the remaining questions will not change. Results should be the same for each question. Total question number and points should update with each deletion.No error should be thrown when the last question is deleted. The section will remain even though there are no questions. Verify the tab order is correct and in order.

testcase.summary: Verify the ability of an assessments author to remove questions from an exam with a question pool.
testcase.preconditions: :There must be a course with a professor and an exam created in that course.

step.actions: Data Setup:Create an exam with multiple questions pooled in one section. Test should include one of each 7 question types. The pool should be set up for 5 questions out of 7.Five points each should be assigned.
step.expectedresults: You are now ready to delete questions.Line should read "5 of 7 questions - 25 pts" All 7 existing questions will be pooled on the page, under the schedule/configuration/introduction tab bar and under the 'X' Add Question and '+ Add Section' buttons (when implemented).There will be 7 questions listed in the Section info with a total of 35 points. - The user will be returned to the page and the deleted question will no longer be displayed. (Note: Deleted questions do not actually get removed from the DB.) - There will be a verification message at the top of the window "Your changes have been saved Similar results as the previous step, plus: - The number of questions at the top will change to reflect 5 questions instead of 6. - The number of points at the top stay at 25. - The 'pool' option of the section will now display 5 out of 5 total questions pooled."5 of 5 questions - 25 pts" Similar results as the previous step, plus: - The number of questions at the top will change to reflect 4 instead of 5. - The number of points at the top will drop to 20. - The 'pool' option of the section will now display 4 out of 4 total questions pooled."4 of 4 questions - 20 pts" Results should be the same for each question. - Total question number should decrement by one for each deltion. - Total points should decrement by five with each deletion. - The pooled numbers will decrement by one with each deletion. Ex: 3 of 3, 2 of 2, 1 of 1. - No error should be thrown when the last question is deleted. The section will remain even though there are no questions."3 of 3 questions - 15 pts""2 of 2 questions - 10 pts""1 of 1 question - 5 pts""0 of 0 questions - 0 pts" Verify the tab order is correct and in order.

testcase.summary: This test will verify that the student will not be kicked out by the course after they have refreshed the auth token.
testcase.preconditions: :A prof and student must be enrolled in a Digital Vellum course.

step.actions: Data Setup:Create an exam. Either do not set the timer or make it longer than an hour.(An hour is the environment kickout setting if the auth token is not refreshed.)
step.expectedresults: The exam will be saved, which will cause the auth token to be refreshed. The user will not be kicked out of the exam. No error will be thrown. The user will be allowed to remain in the exam and then submit the exam and see the summary page.

testcase.summary: This test case covers the Happy Path functionality for the ability to move questions from a regular section to a pooled section.It also covers the point value testing of questions as they are moved between sections and pools.
testcase.preconditions: :There should be an exam created and a professor/student enrolled in the course.

step.actions: Data Setup:Login as a professor.Create an exam with fourteen questions, two of each type. (Pre-July release this will have to be done by using the wormhole into the old exams - Modify/Import.) Do not assign any points to the questions while they are being created.Using the new Exam UI (Modify/Manage), create a second section and move 7 questions (one of each type) into that second section.In the first section, assign the questions a value of one point each. Make the second section pooled. Give a value of two points to each question. (The number of questions to be included in the pool does not matter.)
step.expectedresults: You are now ready to move questions.Verify you have two sections:1. NonPooled: with 7 questions at 1 point each2. Pooled: with 7 questions at 2 points each The questions will move as expected.No confirmation message will be given.All 7 question types can be moved without error. The questions should retain their new order. The questions will move as expected.No confirmation message will be given.All 7 question types can be moved without error.Neither the number of pooled questions nor the points for that section will have changed. Because the question is in a pool, the value will not be editable.Either the Edit button will be disabled (only pre-July until we get additional Edit functionality added) or the user will not be allowed to save the new point value. Question is moved to bottom of list. The questions should retain their new order. The non-pooled section will now have 6 questions total, each still 1 point. - The section header will correctly reflect the number of questions and points total.The pooled section will now have 8 question total, each at 2 points. - The moved question will inherit the two-point value of that pool. - The section header will correctly reflect "7 of 8" questions. The seven will not change when incrementing the pool with extra questions. - The total number of points for that section will not change since the total is based on the number pooled, not the the number total. The non-pooled section will now have 8 questions total. - Six questions will have 1 point each. - The two questions that had lived in the pool will retain their two point value. - The section header will correctly reflect the number of questions and points total.The pooled section will now have 6 question total, each still at 2 points. - The section header will correctly reflect "6 of 6" questions. If the threshold was originally set at 7, each time the question pool is decremented, the number will be reduced as well. If another question is removed, it will reflect 5 of 5 and so on. - The total number of points for that section will not change since the total is based on the number pooled, not the the number total. These values will be verified when the student takes the exam. First Section:Verify the Question Order. They questions should be displayed in their correct sections and will be listed in the correct order.Verify the Point Values. Each question will reflect the currently-assigned points.Second (pooled) section: - 4 questions will be pulled from this section. - Each question will reflect two points.

testcase.summary: This test case covers the Happy Path functionality for the ability to move questions between two pooled sections.
testcase.preconditions: :There should be an exam created and a professor/student enrolled in the course.

step.actions: Data Setup:Login as a professor.Create an exam with fourteen questions, two of each type. (Pre-July release this will have to be done by using the wormhole into the old exams - Modify/Import.)Using the new Exam UI (Modify/Manage), create a second section and move 7 questions (one of each type) into that second section.Make the first section pooled with 3 pooled questions and a value of one point each. Make the second section pooled with four pooled questions and a value of two points to each question.
step.expectedresults: You are now ready to move questions.Verify the first pooled section reflects:3 of 7 questions - 3 pointsVerify the second pooled section reflects:4 of 7 questions - 8 points The first section will now have 6 questions total, each still 1 point. - The section header will reflect 3 of 6 questions with 3 points total (still 3 questions at 1 pt each).The second section will now have 8 question total, each at 2 points. - The moved question will inherit the two-point value of that pool. - The section header will correctly reflect "4 of 8" questions. - The total number of points for that section will still reflect 8 points total (still 4 questions at 2 pts each). The first section will now have 8 questions total. - The section header will reflect 3 of 8 questions with 3 points total (still 3 questions at 1 pt each).The second section will now have 6 questions total, each still at 2 points. - The section header will correctly reflect "4 of 6" questions. - The total number of points for that section will still reflect 8 points total (still 4 questions at 2 pts each). The questions should retain their new order. These values will be verified when the student takes the exam. Verify the pooled questions are pulling correctly: - 3 questions from the first pool. - 4 questions from the second pool.Verify the Point Values. Each question will reflect the currently-assigned points, depending on which pool it is assigned to.

The first section will now have 8 questions total. - All questions will retain their original point value. - The section header will correctly reflect the number of questions and points total.The second section will now have 6 question total. - All questions will retain their original point value. - The section header will correctly reflect the number of questions and points total. testcase.summary: This test case covers edge testing (boundary testing, error handling, negative testing) for assigning points per question for individual questions (non-pooled section).(Note: The positive UAC testing for points per question is handled with the Author Moving Questions and also CRUD Operations on Sections test cases.)

testcase.summary: This test case covers the edge testing scenarios for moving questions within/between section(s).
testcase.preconditions: :A DV course must be created with a professor and student(s) enrolled.

step.actions: Data Setup:Create an exam with fourteen questions, two of each type.
step.expectedresults: The section edit with pool options dialogue will open.The number of total questions will be listed in that dialogue, ex: "Randomly select ____ questions of 14 at ____ points each." The pool will be saved without error. The pool will be saved without error. For the first pool (starting with 14 questions) verify: - The number of total questions will decrement by one with each question moved out. - The number of pooled questions will remain at 11 until the total number reaches 11, at which point they will decrement together to always show the same number. - The total number of points will remain the same until the pooled number drops below 11, at which time the points will be decremented with each move.For the first pool (starting with 0 questions) verify: - The total number of questions increments with each move. - The pooled number of questions remains the same. - The total number of points will remain the same. - The question-level point value will change so that the questions now have the point value assigned to this pool. This section will have question(s) moved in/out to verify point values. The point value will be retained when a question is moved into a non-pooled section. The new point value will be saved and reflected in the total for that section. The point value will be changed to the value that this pool assignes.The last section will display a total of 0 points since the question was moved out.

step.actions: Login to the exam as prof and go to modify - manage

They should be radio buttons, instead of checkboxes. Verify that tooltips in the following areas are displaying:This includes (but may not be limited to): - Edit - Delete - Move Up - Move Down(All above for both Question and Section areas.) - Add Section - Update Section - Cancel Expected results should be expected Verify the following:1. the instructions for the matching questions is displayed as a link, instead of the entire text (FUTURE RELEASE)2. the timer should be hanging right underneath the blue bar (the course title area).3. all question numbering before the quesitons should be displayed as '0' (temporarily removed, will reactivate after July release) Verify that the big percentage score is displaying on the summary page Verify that there should not be any gray background comment box displaying before the prof add any comment. Gradebook - Grade by Assignment page is displayed. Gradebook detail shoould be displayed at the lower portion of the screen. The comments and grade box is displayed. Comments should be saved without error. Verify that now the gray background instructor comments box should be displayed. Buttons should be written with as few spans as possible.

testcase.summary: Enter text
testcase.preconditions: Enter text

step.actions: When creating a pooled section, there are two required entries for setup. The number of questions per pool, and the number of points each question is worth. Run thru tests for each field:1. Cannot enter a blank.2. Cannot enter a space in between numbers.3. Cannot enter a negative number.4. Cannot enter alpha characters.5. Cannot enter a combo of numbers and alpha characters.6. Can enter a zero7. Can enter up to a three digit number (999)
step.expectedresults: Verify each test results. Verify a pooled section with no questions can be added. Display will read "0 of 0 questions - 0 points" Verify the correct display shows and that you can now assign points to the question and change the count. Verify that when the number of points is changed, each question within the pool will change to that number. Verify that the total points reflect the number of questions multiplied by the point value.Example: 3 questions at 3 points each will reflect 9 points The question will assume the point value per questions that was assigned in the pool. Verify that when the question is moved, it will automatically reflect the pool point value.The middle number will increase by one when a question is added to the pool automatically.The number of questions and the points remain the same. Verify the example of listed will decrement properly. Verify the behavior is different when removing questions that go below the threshold number of questions assigned in the pool.

The first question will truncate each option/potnetial answer to display no more then 30 characters.

testcase.summary: This test case covers the styling for the 'Aggregated Class Results' (i.e., Exam Statistics) page for an exam.Included here is the logic for both the Performance Bar and the Participants Graph.This test covers happy path only.
testcase.preconditions: :There must be a course created with a professor and six students enrolled.

step.actions: Data Setup: Create six exams with 10 questions each. Use auto-grade quests only, i.e., Mult Choice & T/F.Each question will be worth 10 points for a total of 100 pts.
step.expectedresults: You are now ready to run six sets of tests. Verify that the Performance graph displays as expected. Because there was a wide variety of responses, the middle bar should be tallest and displayed as green.The Performance non-graph data should be correctly populated (Questions, Participants, Mean, etc.) - Mean is the average of the highest and lowest scores. - Mode is the most frequent grade. In this case because there are no two scores alike all results will be listed here.Ensure that the Participants Graph correctly reflects the results. (X axis is % score. Y axis is of users that received said score and is dynamic.) In this case because there are no two scores alike, X axis will be one person and will have that value on each of the five scores received. Verify that the Performance graph displays as expected. Because the response falls in 0-19%, the left bar should be tallest and displayed as red.The Performance non-graph data should be correctly populated (Questions, Participants, Mean, etc.) - Mean is the average of the highest and lowest scores. - Mode is the most frequent grade. In this case because there are no two scores alike all results will be listed here.Ensure that the Participants Graph correctly reflects the results. (X axis is % score. Y axis is of users that received said score and is dynamic.) Verify that the Performance graph displays as expected. Because the response falls in 20-44%, the second-to-left bar should be tallest and displayed as yellow/orange.The Performance non-graph data should be correctly populated (Questions, Participants, Mean, etc.) - Mean is the average of the highest and lowest scores. - Mode is the most frequent grade. In this case because there are no two scores alike all results will be listed here.Ensure that the Participants Graph correctly reflects the results. (X axis is % score. Y axis is of users that received said score and is dynamic.) Verify that the Performance graph displays as expected. Because the response falls in45-75%, the middle bar should be tallest and displayed as green.The Performance non-graph data should be correctly populated (Questions, Participants, Mean, etc.) - Mean is the average of the highest and lowest scores. - Mode is the most frequent grade. In this case because there are no two scores alike all results will be listed here.Ensure that the Participants Graph correctly reflects the results. (X axis is % score. Y axis is of users that received said score and is dynamic.) Verify that the Performance graph displays as expected. Because the response falls in 75-90%, the second-to-right bar should be tallest and displayed as yellow/orange.The Performance non-graph data should be correctly populated (Questions, Participants, Mean, etc.) - Mean is the average of the highest and lowest scores. - Mode is the most frequent grade. In this case because there are no two scores alike all results will be listed here.Ensure that the Participants Graph correctly reflects the results. (X axis is % score. Y axis is of users that received said score and is dynamic.) Verify that the Performance graph displays as expected. Because there were two responses for 90-100%, the right bar should be tallest and displayed as red.The Performance non-graph data should be correctly populated (Questions, Participants, Mean, etc.) - Mean is the average of the highest and lowest scores. - Mode is the most frequent grade. In this case because there are two instances of 100%, that grade will be posted here.Ensure that the Participants Graph correctly reflects the results. (X axis is % score. Y axis is of users that received said score and is dynamic.) In this case the X axis will be equal to two people which is what will be displayed at the 100% mark. The other scores will all have a 1 for the axis which is equal to half of the height of the graph.

testcase.summary: This test case is to verify "Bug Fix:Course Copying over without Assessments" that was discovered when the admin dupes a course that has a pooled exam.The digital vellum duper wasn't copying over the "BasePointsPerQuestion" column for exams that had pooled sections. Since Assessments was looking for that column, the exam would then not load the View or Manage screens in the duped course.The fix is being made to the REST service so that we are no longer looking for that column.This test will encompass creating a pooled exam, a non-pooled exam, and a pooled-exam that then gets unpooled. The course will then be duped and a mini-regression run on those assessments with a prof and a student to verify that the assessments still work as expected. The basic point update in Gradebook functionality will also be verified.note:This test has been modified to accommodate the new question type - hotspot, as well as Exhibits (the add-on for each question type to provide the student more info for the question)
testcase.preconditions: :A professor and a student must be enrolled in a Digital Vellum course.

Non-pooled exam (all 8 types of question with 5 pts each)3. Unpooled exam (all 8 types of question, 5 pts each, initially pooled with 1 pt each, then unpooled, should still be 1 pt each)4. Each question type should have an Exhibits

The 'Aggregate Results' screen should load without errors for each of the three courses. All of the assessments will save without error.When the professor returns to the tabs for each of the assessments, the changes will be reflected. Verify that 1. all the 8 question types should be loaded without error.2. the exhibits should be loaded for each question without error. All points for each assessment should be correctly reflected in GBK. The exams will load with all the 8 question type and exhibits without issue.The intro pages will load correctly with the newly changed exam intro being displayed.They can be Saved and also Submitted without errors.The review/summary page will load correctly for each assessment. The View (Aggregate Results) screen will load and correcly reflect the participant taken.The Manage screen will also still load correctly for each assessment. You are now ready to have the student view his grades. The results summary page will load correctly.All grades/comments added by the professor will display to the student.

testcase.summary: This test covers negative testing: - In an outcome-enabled institution, logging in as a prof or TA and ensuring you can't see the links to add or delete outcomes (with two sections - one without an outcome and one with an outcome). - In a normal (non-outcome-enabled) institution, logging in as an administrator, professor, and TA and ensuring you can't see the links to add outcomes.
testcase.preconditions: :Two institutions must be created: - One that has been enabled for outcomes and associated with a database of outcomes. - One that has not been enabled for outcomes.There must be an institution-level administrator user enrolled in the course as a Professor for both institutions.There must be a professor enrolled in the course as a Professor for both institutions.There must be a student enrolled in the course as a Teaching Assistant for both institutions.

step.actions: User Setup - Outcome-Enabled Institution:From the Open Class Admin Pages choose an institution that has been enabled to use Outcomes.Create an institution-level admin.Create a professor and enroll in the course.Also create and enroll a teaching assistant (from a student role).
step.expectedresults: The admin, professor, and TA will now be able to login to a DV course.(Note: Admin will open course from the Whittaker Admin Pages.) You now have data to work with. The admin will be returned to the edit section screen.The name of the associated outcome will replace the Associate Outcome link at the section level. The sections should both look the same with no outcome and no link to add an outcome. The sections should both look the same with no outcome and no link to add an outcome. The admin will now be able to acces to a DV course (from the Whittaker Admin Pages). Because this is a non-outcome-enabled insititution the link to add an Outcome should not be available for any users.

testcase.summary: The test will verify through the UI by using Firebug that the REST service does not return the correct answer values on take exam while the student is taking the test or on summary page when the config setting is chosen to not display them.All to be tested: - The summary screen still correctly displays results when the correct config option is chosen.- The gradebook details load with the correct information for the professor.
testcase.preconditions: :There must be a digital vellum course created that has a professor and four students enrolled.

step.actions: Data Setup:Login as a professor.Create an assessment that has at least two sections and one of each question type. (Not necessary to have each question type in each section.)Keep all defaults for Config/Schedule.Ensure that the "Display grade without answers on review date" schedule option is selected (default).
step.expectedresults: You now have an assessment to work with. View the Response calls in Firebug: Console > AllVerify that "iscorrect" never equals "true" and there are no other indicators or correct answers for the assessment.Note: All calls should be investigated but the main page call that displays all questions looks like:https://digitalvellum.next.ecollege-labs.com/studentexams/2078790-438975/sections/1129102/questions/?ecxd.AjaxManager.preventCache=1326229639598 When the summary screen appears verify:- No answers are returned on the screen but the points earned are correct.- No calls in Firebug indicate the correct answers or list the answer options. You are ready to repeat the above test as a student. View the Response calls in Firebug: Console > AllVerify that "iscorrect" never equals "true" and there are no other indicators or correct answers for the assessment.For hotspot question, make sure that the "correctregions" property doesn't contain any value. it should looks similar to:{"questions":{"correctregions":,"questiontype":9...}}Note: All calls should be investigated but the main page call that displays all questions looks like:https://digitalvellum.next.ecollege-labs.com/studentexams/2078790-438975/sections/1129102/questions/?ecxd.AjaxManager.preventCache=1326229639598 When the summary screen appears verify:- No answers are returned on the screen but the points earned are correct.- No calls in Firebug indicate the correct answers or list the answer options (for the hotspot, make sure the "correctregions" doesn't contain any info in the firebug). You are ready to grade the assessment. Ensure that the assessment details load with the correct questions, answers, grades, and choices selected by the student.Enter grades/comments for some question(s). You are ready to view your graded assessment. When the summary screen appears verify:- No answers are returned on the screen but the points earned are correct, including the point change(s) from the professor.- No calls in Firebug indicate the correct answers (for the hotspot, make sure the "correctregions" doesn't contain any info"). Results should be the same: Stu and Prof should not see any hint of correct answers. Verify on all pages while taking assessment. Should get same results but no questions will be shown either. Results should be the same: Stu and Prof should not see any hint of correct answers. Verify on all pages while taking assessment. The assessment will redisplay with no answers saved. (Note: If the prof made a change to the assessment after the student took it then this change will be reflected upon retake.)No correct answers should been seen. No "didstudentgetcorrect" should be seen while taking the exam.

Save.Select the Configuration tab.Ensure that "Student can take this exam multiple times." is checked. Saved.

The professor will be returned to the author assessment screen with the new question added.The answer-level feedback will be viewable on this screen for each distractor and will correctly reflect what was entered.Feedback for correct answers will be in a green balloon and feedback for incorrect distractors will be in a red balloon. You are now ready to add answer-level feedback to a many mult choice (mult answer) question. The professor will be returned to the author assessment screen with the new question added.The answer-level feedback will be viewable on this screen for each distractor and will correctly reflect what was entered.Feedback for correct answers will be in a green balloon and feedback for incorrect distractors will be in a red balloon. The Summary Results screen will allow the user to expand all questions where the answer and corresponding feedback will be seen.The feedback will be displayed for the answers chosen only. (Answer-level feedback does not appear if the answer choice was not selected.)Feedback for correct answers will be in a green balloon and feedback for incorrect distractors will be in a red balloon. You are now ready to verify the student's summary results screen.The retake functionality will be used to verify all of the possible answer/distractor choices. The Summary Results screen will allow the user to expand all questions where the answer and corresponding feedback will be seen.The feedback will be displayed for the answers chosen only. (Answer-level feedback does not appear if the answer choice was not selected.)Feedback for correct answers will be in a green balloon and feedback for incorrect distractors will be in a red balloon. The Summary Results screen will allow the user to expand all questions where the answer and corresponding feedback will be seen.The feedback will be displayed for the answers chosen only. (Answer-level feedback does not appear if the answer choice was not selected.)Feedback for correct answers will be in a green balloon and feedback for incorrect distractors will be in a red balloon. The Summary Results screen will allow the user to expand all questions where the answer and corresponding feedback will be seen.The feedback will be displayed for the answers chosen only. (Answer-level feedback does not appear if the answer choice was not selected.)Feedback for correct answers will be in a green balloon and feedback for incorrect distractors will be in a red balloon. You are now ready to view the results in Gradebook details. The Gradebook Details screen will load and allow the user to expand all questions where the answer and corresponding feedback will be seen.The answer-level feedback will be displayed for the student's selected choices.Feedback for correct answers will be in a green balloon and feedback for incorrect distractors will be in a red balloon. You are now ready to view the newly-altered results summary screen. The Summary Results screen will allow the user to expand all questions where the answer and corresponding feedback will be seen.Any comments/grade changes from the professor will be reflected here but the feedback will still be given as exptected:- The feedback will be displayed for the answers chosen only. (Answer-level feedback does not appear if the answer choice was not selected.)- Feedback for correct answers will be in a green balloon and feedback for incorrect distractors will be in a red balloon.

testcase.summary: This test verifies that the instructor has the ability to reset student assessment in the gradebook details. After the assessment has been reset, all the student's previously saved/submitted answers are cleared.
testcase.preconditions: :1. A professor and student must have already enrolled into a course with assessments.2. Create 3 assessments with each has 7 types of questions, also: a. first assessment has everything left to default (single take, review date is current and Display grade without answers on Review Date) b. second assessment is a multitake c. third assessment is set for pooling.

step.actions: login the course as student and take the first exam (single take with all default) created in the PreConditions, and submit.
step.expectedresults: The exam should be submitted without error. Gradebook main page should be displayed. You should be taken to the Grade by Assignment screen. The page should refresh with the list of students who enrolled in the course. 1. You should be taken to the gradebook detail screen.2. There should be a Details section located at the bottom of this screen. Verify that "Reset Student Assessment" button is showing under the summary title. 1. Verify that the confirmation message box stating "You are about to clear all of the student's answers and results for this assignment. Would you like to continue?" is displayed.2. There should be Continue and Cancel buttons on this message box. 1. The confirmation message should be canceled.2. The answers are not cleared in the gradebook details. Verify that Begin button isn't shown as the exam reset has been cancelled. 1. The answers should be all cleared in the gradebook details for this student.2. It shouldn't show anything in the details as if the student hasn't taken this exam. Verify that Begin button, instead of Take Exam again button is shown now. 1. The student should be taken into the exam.2. Verify that all the previous answers are cleared. Verify on the results page that the correct answers are not shown, but should score properly. 1. Verify that again the Reset Student Assessment button is shown.2. The answers and scores are correctly shown in the details for each questions. The answers should be all cleared. Verify that Begin button should be shown for the assessment. Verify that all the previous answers are cleared. 1. Verify that all the answers and scores show correctly on the results page.2. Verify that Reset Student Assessment function as expected.3. Verify that student answers are all cleared and be able take the exam fresh after reset. Verify that all the answers and scores are reflected correctly on the results page. The answers should be cleared and the assessment should be reset. The Begin button, instead of Take Exam Again button should be shown. Verify that all the previous answers and cleared. Verify that the correct number of questions are shown. Verify that the exam is submitted without error. Changes are saved. The assessment is reset successfully. Begin button should be shown. Verify1. that the questions are randomized.2. that the exam is loaded with all the newly added questions.3. that the deleted question no long exists. Verify that results page display correctly. The answers are cleared and assessment is reset without error.

testcase.summary: Negative/Edge Tests to be verified: - Scheduler: "Display grade without answers on Review Date" selected: No feedback given. - Scheduler: "Display grade with answers on Review Date" selected but review date in future: No feedback given. - Questions with both Question-level and answer-level feedback. - Prof changes feedback after creating the question. Student sees newly saved feedback.
testcase.preconditions: :A Digital Vellum course must be created with a professor and at least one student enrolled.

step.actions: Test One - Data Setup:As professor, set up an assessment with the following:- Schedule tab will have the option "Display grade without answers on Review Date" selected (default).- Review date is in the past (default).- T/F, MC, and MMC questions- Answer-level feedback for each option on each question type.Logout as a professor.
step.expectedresults: The assessment is now ready for the student. The Summary Results screen will list the questions.Expand each question and verify that no answers are displayed.Note: This test verifies that having answer-level feedback will not force the answer options to be seen when they shouldn't be. The assessment is now ready for the student. The Summary Results screen will not display any questions. It will have a message stating that the assessment will be available for viewing at a later date (the future review date chosen by the professor).Note: This test verifies that having answer-level feedback will not force the answer options to be seen when they shouldn't be. The assessment is now ready for the student. The Summary Results screen displays the following:- Correct answer-level feedback, including the changes made by the professor.- General question-level feedback in a blue bubble underneath the answer choices.

testcase.summary: The test case covers various Assessments testing scenarios.It can be used for mini-regression test purposes where all of the following options need to be tested, but not with each and every other option (e.g., mix and match tests):Schedule - Start and End Date, past and futureSchedule - Review Date, past and future, display with and without answersConfiguration - Single take & Multi-takeConfiguration - Various time limits, with and without kickoutConfiguration - Single page and multiple page, with one section per page and one question per pageConfiguration - Objective score, displayed and not displayedConfiguration - Full Credit Only and Partial PointsIntroduction - Intro and no introSections - One section, multiple sections, pooled section(s)Questions - All question types, with and without feedbackAuthor Page - Add question/section, edit question/section, move question/section, delete question/sectionProfessor Preview - With correctly and incorrectly answered optionsStudent Take - With correctly and incorrectly answered optionsSummary Results Page - With above Schedule/Config optionsView/Performance Screen - Before and after student takesPlease note: These test steps are very high-level and are meant for a tester who is already familiar with Assessments and the various choices.
testcase.preconditions: :At least one professor and one student must be enrolled in a DV course.

step.actions: Verify that the following options work as expected:Schedule - Start and End Date - each in the past and each in the future

testcase.summary: This test verifies that when the time for a single take assessment is not set (uncheck the time box) or 0, the student should be able to answers questions and submit exam without error.
testcase.preconditions: :1. A single take exam with all 7 types of questions has been created2. A professor and student enrolled in the course.3. Firebug is installed.
