step.expectedresults: Change is saved. Verify that the Time allowed to complete: is blank on the Begin Exam page. Verify that the exam is loaded correctly. Verify that the REST calls for submission returns 200 for all 7 questions, instead of 403 (access denied). For example for True and False question, the call should look like the following when clicking on an answer:POST https://digitalvellum.next.ecollege.com/studentexams/9798302-18488330/questions/29501655-1-1/numericsubmission/ 200 The answers should be saved without error. Verify that the exam is submitted without error and that in the firebug that the endexam, examtogradebook and results REST calls are all successfully made (return 200). These calls should look like the following:http://assessments-api.ecollege-labs.com/studentexams/2078790-439050/endexam/?ecxd.AjaxManager.preventCache=1327369562648/ 200http://assessments-api.ecollege-labs.com/users/me/courses/2025095/refIds/36/examtogradebook/ 200http://assessments-api.ecollege-labs.com/studentexams/2078790-439050/results/?ecxd.AjaxManager.preventCache=1327369562847/ 200 Verify that the answers are submitted correctly. Verify that correct behaviors should be observed. Verify that correct behaviors should be observed. Verify that correct behaviors should be observed.

testcase.summary: This test verifies that the new question type hotspot is funtioning and styled as expected.
testcase.preconditions: :PreConditions:1. An exam with at least two hotspot questions (one with maxpicks=1 and the other with maxpicks=3) have been created. note: for the ease of testing, we are using the xray image hotspots the dev created throughout the test (untill the hotspot authoring UI is available, by then this test case will need to be modified so its not specific to the example images). The default setting of the image are as follow: a. for the maxpicks=1 image, the correctregion is a rectangle with width of 30, height of 25 and coordinates 127,75 (the brain area); for the maxpicks=3 image, the correctregioins consist of three same size rectangles: center of the brain, just the right of the brain, and just the left of the brain areas. b. question text is "Click a spot on the image that shows the brain" c. number of points is 9 for maxpicks=1 image and 15 for maxpicks=3 image d. explanation is "Explanation goes here" e. maxpicks=1 (9 pts) and maxpicks=3 (15 pts) (maxpicks is not shown on the UI, so you can only tell by it's pts) 2. A professor and student enrolled in the course.3. Use default configuration except for the following options: a. Multiple take (again, this is just for the ease of testing. you can also use single take instead and reset the assessment in the GBK after each take) b. online review date in the past and with Display grade WITH answers on Review Date

step.actions: Student logs into the exam and click Begin Exam
step.expectedresults: Hotspot questions are loaded without error. Verify that:1. the question text is displayed correctly at the top of the image.2. the points is displayed at the right to the question text. 3. the image is displayed correctly.4. Reset button is located at the bottom of the question.5. at the bottom of the screen, make sure that the hotspot question is included in the total question count. Verify that the selection is displayed at the center of the brain area correctly.Note the selection should be displayed as a small circle with blue center and black&white strokes around the outside. Verify on the result page that this hotspot question should be scored correctly (9 pts in this example) and that the section is updated with the hotspot's score as well.Note 1. the correctness of the answer depends on the exact coordinates of where the user clickedessentially that means the coordinates that are at the very tip of the mouse pointer. So, the coordinates sent as answers are at the very center of the blue circles.2. the blue circle is a bit large, so even though parts of it might appear to be on the correct regions, the centers need to be on the correct regions to be marked as correct. Verify on the result page that you should be scored as 0 because hotspot question's scoring mechanism is all or nothing. Verify that the selections are displayed at the center, left and right of the brain areas respectively. Verify on the result page that this hotspot question should be scored correctly (15 pts in this example). Verify on the result page that you should be scored as 0. Verify on the result page that you should be scored as 0. Verify that the selections are removed from the image. Verify on the result page that you should be scored as 15. Configration changes are saved. The answer should be auto-saved and retained. The answer is saved. Verify that the answer should be rtained. On the result page, expand to the detailed view and verify that1. the question text should be displayed at the top, pts on the right and they are aligned on the same line.2. in the detailed area, there should be four buttons to the left and the button label text are: Toggle overlay, Toggle correct answers, Toggle your answers and Toggle all3. the image should be displayed to the right with overlay, correct answers (correctregions) in green background, your answers (with blue center and black&white strokes around the outside) all showing be default.4. the scoring percentage at the section level is updated with hotspot pts included. Verify that an overlay is un-applied on the image (since the milky overlay is applied by default).Note this xray image may not be a good example to show overlay. But the overlay should look better on an sharp contrast picture such as scenary picture. Verify that the overlay returns. Verify that the correct regions (the green rectangle in this example) are hidden. Verify that the correct regions are displayed again. Verify that all your correct and wrong answers are hidden. Verify that all your correct and wrong answers are displaying again. Verify that all the overlay, correct answers and your answers are cleared, and the image should look like when the student first takes it in stdent take view. Verify that all the overlay, correct answers and your answers are displaying again. Verify that the Preview fuctions the same as it does on the student take and results. Verify that in the GBK details1. All the UI and functions behave the same as they do on the student result page.2. The explanation box (the light blue box) and text ("Explanation goes here) is displayed correctly.3. The comment and point update box (the grey hot dog) is displayed correctly. new points saved. Verify that the updated points is displayed correctly Verify the Assessment should be cleared in the GBK detail view. Verify that the previous answers for the hotspot are cleared. configuration is saved. The expected behaviors should be observed. The configuration change is saved. Verify on the result page that the big score is showing and reflecting the hotspots points as well. The expected behaviors should be observed. Change is saved. Verify on the result page that no details info is shown for any of the hotspot questions. Verify on the result page that no details info is shown for any of the hotspot questions. Verify on the GBK details that the detailed info is displayed correctly for the hotspot questions (refer to step 16 - 24). Change is saved. Verify that it should display a message stating "The results of this exam will be available on xxx" (xxx is the future date you just specified). Verify that it should display a message stating "The results of this exam will be available on xxx" (xxx is the future date configured above).

testcase.summary: This test verifies edge test cases for the new question type "hotspot", plus additional negative testing.
testcase.preconditions: :PreConditions:A professor and several students should be enrolled in the course.(For ease of testing you can reuse the same assessment and just change the values. Be aware that each time the professor changes a setting a new student will have to be used to see the change.)Note: These test steps are very high-level and are meant for a tester who is already familiar with Assessments, including how to create a HotSpot question type.

step.actions: Restrict hotspot assessment by start date and end date. Put both in the future. - Take as a student.Restrict hotspot assessment by start date and end date. Put both in the past. - Take as a student.
step.expectedresults: In both cases the user should not be allowed in the assessment. The hotspot question should not display. In all cases the assessment should be available, the hotspot question available, and should behave as expected.Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradebook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. For both users, the hotspot question should be marked wrong. (This indicates that the original auto-saved was saved over when the assessment was submitted.)Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradebook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. Verify:a) The question is marked as correct b) The of clicks recorded was done after the reset (i.e., the question wasn't marked incorrect because of too many clicks).Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradebook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. Verify both Prof Preview and Student can still see the image, click on both correct and incorrect hotspots and that the assessment is graded appropriately.Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradebook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. Verify that the new hotspot answer is saved. Changes made after the time is up should be saved.Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradebook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. Verify that the hotspot answer was saved.Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradebook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. Verify that the hotspot questions all display correctly on one page.After submitting the assessment, verify that the regions chosen by the user are correctly indicated on each question and not mixed up between questions.Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradebook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. Verify that only two of the three hotspot questions display.After submitting the assessment, verify that correct two questions are displayed in the results page.Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradbook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. Verify that the hotspot questions display correctly on all pages and can be successfully answered.After submitting the assessment, verify that the regions chosen by the student are correctly indicated on each question.Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradbook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. Verify that the hotspot questions display correctly on all pages and can be successfully answered.After submitting the assessment, verify that the regions chosen by the student are correctly indicated on each question.Verify that the grading is accurate in that incorrectly-answered questions are marked wrong with no points received and correclty-answered questions are marked correct with full points.Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradbook Details for this exam and student to verify that it correctly reflects the same results. For both users:- The exam intro will display when the student clicks on the assessment. - The questions will be in the correct order. - After submitting, the objective score will not be displayed. No score will be sent to the gradebook (which is a new user story with this iteration).Follow-up Test: - As a student leave and then return to the summary screen to ensure that this student 'exam details' page also correctly reflects the same results. - As a professor go to Gradbook for this exam and student and verify that no grades were sent. The professor should still be able to see and edit Details. Verify that the number of questions should include the hotspot question type.Both graphs should be correct regarding number of students and grading.All other information the page should be correct.

testcase.summary: This test verifies that DV Gradebook database changes for Sharding is working as expected.
testcase.preconditions: :1. An exam with all 8 types of questions (traditional 7 plus the hotspot) has been created.2. A professor and student must enroll in the course.3. Firebug is installed.4. Configured to use Review Date -> Display grade with answers on Review Date." option in the Scheduler tab.Here's the query to determine Gradebook Shard:--GradebookID is the CourseIDUse DigitalVellumGradebookselect * from dbo.GradebookToGradebookContext where GradebookID = 2027446--ContextID = 1000000000049--This is found in Shard 1 (DigitalVellumGradebook_001)Use DigitalVellumGradebookselect * from dbo.GradebookToGradebookContext where GradebookID = 2025296--ContextID = 2000000000029--This is found in Shard 2 (DigitalVellumGradebook_002)Use DigitalVellumGradebookselect * from dbo.GradebookToGradebookContext where GradebookID = 2026743--ContextID = 38--This is found in main Shard (DigitalVellumGradebook)

step.actions: Login to the exam as student and answer all the 8 questions, submit.
step.expectedresults: Verify that1. in the firebug, the REST service call to send the scores to the gradebook should be made and return 204.note: the call should look similar as follows: PUT http://assessments-api.ecollege-labs.com/users/me/courses/2025442/refIds/2/examgrade/publish2. on the results page, the scores for all the question are correct3. the scores and percentage are reflected correctly on the section as well. Verify on the gradebook detail that1. the scores for each question are correct.2. the scores and percentage are reflected correctly on the section as well. Verify that1. in the firebug, for each question upon save, the same REST call for publishing scores to the gradebook is made without error.2. the points is updated correctly for the question and section. Verify that the points are updated correctly on the results page.

step.actions: Student login to the exam created in the preconditions, without answer any questions and click Save & Submit Exam button.
step.expectedresults: Exam is submitted without error. Verify the query results, in the NumberOfPointsObtained column that it should display "-1" for all types of questions. Expand the questions and verify that points should be displayed as "0" for all question, instead of "-1" except for the partially scored questions such as MMC question which may show the partial scores. Notes: even though it shows "-1" in the DB, the UI code fix changed the display to "0" for unanswered questions.

testcase.summary: This test will cover the happy path functionality of using an Exhibit for all question types.Note: Currently Hotspot and Matching are not supported (although they may still work) so testing for those is not needed and/or can be done after all other question types are tested.
testcase.preconditions: :A professor and students must be enrolled in a course.An assessment must be created with the following question types:TFMCMMCFIBSAEQThere must be an exhibit created for each question type. This exhibit is for Happy Path and so should have a moderate amount of text for description, label titles, exhibit titles, and a smallish image. (Currently under 400x400 but future 400x600.)Note: Currently there is no author ability so this must be done via Fiddler through the REST service.

step.actions: Take an assessment that has Exhibit for all appropriate question types (see Details Description for this test).Verify that the exhibit loads correctly for each question by and that the user can switch between tabs and scroll if necessary.Verify the correct character length for Exhibit button and title.
step.expectedresults: Verify that the following information correctly reflects what was authored: - Exhibit button name (s/b same as Exhibit name) - Exhibit name - Tab names - Content within tabs - images and text - Verify that styles correctly reflect the current OC style. Verify basic accepted 'good' functionality: - Exhibit opens/closes as expected - User can switch back and forth between tabs. - If an exhibit is closed with the focus on the 2nd tab will it will remain there when reopened. - User can answer questions when exhibit is opened and closed without the answer being deleted - Attempting to open more than one exhibit on a page does not throw an error. - The exhibit can be returned to the screen/browser if moved off. - Browser can be maximized/minimized/restored with the exhibit open and this will not affect exhibit functionality. - User can click Save and Save/Submit with an open exhibit and this will not impede expected functionality.

testcase.summary: This test will cover edge and negative scenarios for Exhibits.Note: Currently Hotspot and Matching are not supported (although they may still work) so testing for those is not needed and/or can be done after all other question types are tested.
testcase.preconditions: :A professor and students must be enrolled in a course.An assessment must be created with an exhibit attached to at least one of the following question types:TFMCMMCFIBSAEQSince the exhibit is for edge testing it should have the following:Over 40 characters for exhibit name.Over 20 characters for tab names.Images over 400x550Large amount of description text (to enable scroll bars within the tab)Note: Currently there is no author ability so this must be done via Fiddler through the REST service.

step.actions: Verify the correct character length for Exhibit button and title with an exhibit that goes over the max allowed.Take/Preview the assessment.
step.expectedresults: The Exhibit title allows 40 characters. We will only display 20 of these in the button. The hover text (tooltip) should allow 40 chars.(Note: The word 'Exhibit' will be populated by default later when author mode is implemented. Additionally, the 40 char limit will be restricted on author side when that's implemented. The tooltip should still be restricted to 40 though.) The tab limit is 20 characters. This may be truncated to 10 with all 20 being visible in the hover text (tool tip). Special chars should be displayed without issue. The outer area should be restricted to 400x550. The user should still be able to see the entire image. There will be scroll bars available. The window should not resize to larger than 400x550 (which can be seen in Firebug by using the Inspect Element feature). Exhibits should load as expected.Attempting to open mutliple exhibits on one section or between sections will not cause errors. Instead the old exhibit will close and the new one will open centered on the screen. Exhibits are correctly assigned to the questions and spread across multiple pages.The exhibit will have consistent functionality on each page.The user can switch between pages (with & arrow buttons) with exhibits open and closed without any odd functionality seen. The exhibit should move along with the question and be correctly displayed to the user when taking the exam. Once an exhibit is moved off the screen it cannot be recovered; however there are two ways around this:a) Click the Esc button and then reopen the Exhibitb) Click on the exhibit button to reopen (this will always recenter the exhibit) Ensure that the exhibit can still be seen after the browsers is maximized and restored and that the user can still move it, switch between tabs, use arrows (if many tabs), etc. Ensure the exhibit does not freeze. The exhibit should reopen without error. Any other exhibits in the assessment can also be opened/reopened after this. The question should still have the same exhibit associated with it. The exhibit can be viewed and navigated through. Ensure that there are right/left arrows to flip through tabs, as well a drop-down which lists all of the tabs. The user should be able to navigate using the dropdown as well as the arrows.

testcase.summary: Changing the data type in the ECSDB from Int to BigInt for the MultipleChoice question to increase the cap for this question type.This test case covers: - Existing Assessment with MC (from Gold Image)- Retake- QTI - WPS MC question upload- QTI - Respondus MC question upload- QTI - TestGen MC question upload- Take - Student- Duper with Student Take, Results Summary, and GBK Details after dup
testcase.preconditions: :An OC Course with professor and students enrolled that has an existing assessment (either created for another release or created in the Gold image).Can use: Lab Mgr URL: http://login.berlin.ecollege-labs.com/Prof: lmprof1@ecollege.com/123456 Stu: lmstu2@ecollege.com/123456 through lmstu9@ecollege.com/123456Course: "Lisa Course"Assessment: "Existing Assessment"

step.actions: As a professor, login to a course that has an existing assessment and go to Manage Assessment. Change the config to be a retake exam. (If not already checked, check the box "Student can take this assessment multiple times.")Ensure that the review date is in the past and that the assessment is marked to "Display grade with answers on Review Date".
step.expectedresults: This assessment will now be a retake exam, to be taken multiple times by the student. This package has Multiple Choice questions and will be taken by the student. This package has Multiple Choice questions and will be taken by the student. This package has Multiple Choice questions and will be taken by the student. You are now ready to take the above assessments. The Results Summary page will correctly reflect the Multiple Choice answers selected.The objective score will correctly reflect the answer(s) chosen. The Results Summary page will display the new answer(s) chosen.The old answer(s) will not be displayed.The objective score will correctly reflect the new answer(s) chosen. The Results Summary page will correctly display the multiple choice question(s) and the answer(s) chosen.The objective score will correctly reflect the answer(s) chosen. The Results Summary page will correctly display the multiple choice question(s) and the answer(s) chosen.The objective score will correctly reflect the answer(s) chosen. The Results Summary page will correctly display the multiple choice question(s) and the answer(s) chosen.The objective score will correctly reflect the answer(s) chosen. You are now ready to verify the student's results in GBK. In all cases the multiple choice answer should correctly display what the student answered. For the retake assessment the answer(s) from the retake should be retained rather than from the initial take. You will now verify that the MultChoice question was duped correctly. Verify that the multiple choice question and answer options have been duped correctly. You are now ready to take the above assessment. The results summary page will correctly reflect the answers chosen.The objective score will be calculated correctly.The correct score will be pushed to the Gradebook. Your are now ready to view Gradebook Details for this student. Verify that the Multiple Choice answer selected is displayed and graded correctly for this student.

testcase.summary: This test verifies the code fixes for two issues:1. fix the assessment side - in the sections table(ECSDB), assigning a sectionid to a section when it is created (the default sectionid will be 0, then new section added will start from "1")2. fix bugs: CCNG-372 Assessment Sections Randomly Reorder Themselves in Child Copies.All the versions of duper will be regression tested, includes but not limited to OC, MMND, BCCT, .NExT course copy, content copy (selected content and copy all content), legacy dupe for core duper.
testcase.preconditions: :1. An exam is created in OC, .NExT course, Legacy course.2. access to BCCT ftp sites (this may not be readily available in LM, it will otherwise be verified PQA) 3. Read access to ECSDB

step.actions: Testing OC AssessmentData Setup:Create 3 or more sections with section names/titles in the exam. Under each section, add a couple of questions (make sure these questions are unique for the section as we will check if these questions get reordered when the sections are reordered).
step.expectedresults: You will need at least 3 sections with section titles for this test. Verify in the query results that each section has a corresponding sectionid assigned starting from number "0".Note: Do Not move (reorder) the sections at this point. The course is duped, and users are enrolled without error. The sections should remain the same order as it's course/parent course. In the query results, review that the each section should also have a corresponding sectionid.note: the starting number might be different from the source course (starting from "1" instead of "0"), but as long as they should be in sequential order. Verify that the sections display in the same order as on the authoring page. Verify that the sections display in the same order as what's on the authoring page from prof and that the assessment can be taken without error. The sections are reordered without error. Verify that the sectionids are sorted in the same order as on the UI, and the other columns remain in the same order. Verify that the section orders are displayed as expected. Verify that:1. in DB, the sectionids are sorted correctly2. on the UI, the sections displayed the same way as what's in the source course for prof preview as well as student take. The section title is edited and saved without error. Verify that the sectiontitle is updated, but it is still associated with the same sectionid. section should be deleted without error. Verify that the deleted section is deleted from the db. Expected results should be observed. Expected results should be observed. Expected results should be observed.

testcase.summary: This test is similar to EV7_Author Exam_Prof_Section_Reorder_Duper Fix except that it is for a course that will have Outcomes associated with the assessment.
testcase.preconditions: :There should be a DV/OC course with an admin (enrolled as a professor) and student enrolled in an institutiion that has Outcomes uploaded (ex: "Escher" institution). These are valid Escher Institution logins:Prof/Admin: george@jetson.com \ abc123Student: barney@rubble.com \ abc1235/7/13Testing on the 01's can currently only be done with SOAP-UI PRO, and only with MMND courses.Currently, using the prodtang.properties file with the SOAP-UI using the IMSEnterpriseServices Project. You can find the file on Massive in QA_Share at: \\massive\qa share\escher_MMNDdupe_SoapUI_JHupdatedor in Perforce at: C:\p4\user\_branches\escher_MMNDdupe_SoapUIOpen the IMSEnterpriseServices project.Run the IMS_BVT projectType in "prodtang" in the popup box to dupe a source course with a Study Plan that has Outcomes set up within the Assessments.

step.actions: Testing OC AssessmentData Setup:Ensure you are using an admin logged in as a professor.Create an Assessment item type.Create 3 or more sections with section names/titles in the exam. Add one question to each section (make sure these questions are unique for the section as we will check if these questions get reordered when the sections are reordered).Assign an outcome to each section: - "Edit" the section and save (if necessary) to see the Assign an Outcome link. - Click on the Assign an Outcome link. - From the outcome repository click on the School Repository tab. - Select an outcome from the repository, scroll down, and Add Outcome. - Change the section name to reflect the new outcome. (Ex: FUND-04-11-03) Save.
step.expectedresults: You will need at least 3 sections with section titles and outcomes for this test. Verify in the query results that each section has a corresponding sectionid assigned starting from number "0".Note: Do Not move (reorder) the sections at this point. The course is duped, and users are enrolled without error. The sections should remain the same order as it's course/parent course.The outcomes will still be associated with the correct sections. In the query results, review that the each section should also have a corresponding sectionid.note: the starting number might be different from the source course (starting from "1" instead of "0"), but as long as they are in sequential order this is acceptable. Verify that the sections display in the same order as on the authoring page.Verify that the correct outcomes are associated with the correct sections. Verify that the sections display in the same order as what's on the authoring page from prof and that the assessment can be taken without error.On the summary results page ensure that the sections are still in the correct order. The sections are reordered without error. Verify that the sectionids are sorted in the same order as on the UI, and the other columns remain in the same order. Verify that the section orders are displayed as expected. Verify that:1. in DB, the sectionids are sorted correctly2. on the UI, the sections displayed the same way as what's in the source course for prof preview as well as student take.

testcase.summary: This series of tests verifies that the student receives a message when a database deadlock occurs. This is to let the student know that there is an issue so that he does not expect his grades to be saved/submitted when issues occur.
testcase.preconditions: :- You must have access to Lab Manager's SQL box.- A student and professor must be enrolled in a course. (Multiple students for multiple browser tests.)

step.actions: Please use the attached document to alter the suggested Stored Procedures in the DB and then verify that the student receives the stated message when answering/leaving questions, saving the assessment, or submitting the assessment.
step.expectedresults: Recommended: When testing multiple browsers have one student in each browser, make the change to the SP, verify for all browsers at once, then change the SP back.

testcase.summary: These tests verify a change in the Display/Hide functionality of the Config tab when authoring an assessment. Regardless of whether the DIsplay or Hide radio button is selected the grade should always be posted to the gradebook for the professor.This change is an enhancement to current functionaly as requested in this Jira ticket:CCNG-273: Assessments don't send grade to GB when Results Feature is set to "hide score from student"
testcase.preconditions: :A professor and at least one student must be enrolled in a DV course.

step.actions: Please use the attached document to test various scenarios with the Display/Hide radio buttons.
step.expectedresults: In all cases the grade should be pushed to the gradebook for the professor.The grade should only display for student if the "show" radio button is selected -or- once the professor manually checks the "share" checkbox in Gradebook.

testcase.summary: Verify that foreign language characters (both single and double byte) can be input and display properly in Multiple Chocie answers and answer feedback when a question is being created.
testcase.preconditions: :A professor and a student must be enrolled in a DV/Assessments course.

step.actions: Login as a professor.Access a Digital Vellum course.Use the Modify menu on the upper left to create a new Assessments content item.
step.expectedresults: The assessment will display in the list. The main assessment Manage page will load. The Add Question selection will display. The answer choices will change to reflect the new question type. This can be done without error. This can be done without error. This can be done without error. The question will be highlighted and the border will turn green and "(correct answer)" text displays.Verify that second answer selected is indicated by the above indicators and the first answer selected is lacking all of the indicators. The professor will be taken back to the main assessment manger page.The question will be added to the section.Note: If there are other questions in that section, the new question will be added to the bottom. - The of questions and points for the section will be correctly updated. - The type of question (MMC) will be correctly displayed. - The number of points for the question will display correctly. - The answer choices will be as entered and in the correct order. - The correct answers will be marked with a green check and the incorrect with a red X. You are now ready to verify the new question. Verify that the new question and answers/distractors display as created and the single and doublebyte characters display without issue. Preview of Exam can be Saved and Submitted without error.Professor returns to Authoring page without error.

testcase.summary: Verify that foreign language characters (both single and double byte) can be input and display properly in Multiple Answer question answers and answer feedback when a question is being created.
testcase.preconditions: :A professor and a student must be enrolled in a DV/Assessments course.

step.actions: Login as a professor.Access a Digital Vellum course.Use the Modify menu on the upper left to create a new Assessments content item.
step.expectedresults: The assessment will display in the list. The main assessment Manage page will load. The Add Question selection will display. The answer choices will change to reflect the new question type. This can be done without error. This can be done without error. This can be done without error. All selected answers will be highlighted and the border will turn green and "(correct answer)" text displays. The professor will be taken back to the main assessment manager page.The question will be added to the section.Note: If there are other questions in that section, the new question will be added to the bottom. - The of questions and points for the section will be correctly updated. - The type of question (MMC) will be correctly displayed. - The number of points for the question will display correctly. - The answer choices will be as entered and in the correct order. - The correct answers will be marked with a green check and the incorrect with a red X. You are now ready to verify the new question. Verify that the new question and answers/distractors display as created and the single and doublebyte characters display without issue. Verify that the graphic remains magnified.Verify that an "X" appears in the upper right corner of magnified graphic. Preview of Exam can be Saved and Submitted without error.Professor returns to Authoring page without error.

testcase.summary: This test verifies that the instructor has the ability to view foreign language characters (both single and double byte) in the answers in the Gradebook Details view for multiple choice and many multiple answers questions (RT1,RT6).
testcase.preconditions: :1. The test case of "EV7_Take Exam_Student_Questions Page with Graphic Option" has been executed.2. The exam's Review Date should be configured for "Display grade with answers on Review Date." (will switch to "Display grade without answers on Review Date." option during the test as the instructor should not be gated by any assessments settings).

step.actions: Login to the course as instructor and click on Gradebook from the main menu.
step.expectedresults: Gradebook main page should be displayed. You should be taken to the Grade by Assignment screen. 1. You should be taken to the gradebook detail screen. 2. There should be a Details section located at the bottom of this screen. The detail should be expanded to show the grade summary. Characters display without error. 1. the image with mouse focus should be maginified.2. the magnified iamge size should be constrainted to 400x400 pixels.3. the magnified image can be closed by clicking the x sign or anywhere on the image or by hovering mouse to another image.4. the correct answer should be designated with a green checkmark.5. the incorrect ansswer should be designated with a red x. The changes are saved without error. Characters display without error. The changes are saved without error. Repeat above tests and verify that the instructor is able to see the results details in the Gradebook details view and the images in the answers for MC and MMC questions are loaded, magnified and closed as expected.

testcase.summary: Verify the question page of an exam and single and doublebyte characters within an answer.
testcase.preconditions: :An exam and student must be created with single and doublebyte characters in all answers of a multiple choice and multiple answer questions. Exam results display with answers in detail. Display date set to the past.

step.actions: Access an exam as a student and click on the 'Begin Exam' button.
step.expectedresults: The student will be taken into the exam. Verify the following: - The section (page) title will be at the top. (future release) - At least one multiple choice and one multiple answer question exists with single or doublebyte characters in each answer. Each question can be answered without error.Upon Save and Submit the details of the exam show as expected.

testcase.summary: This test case is to cover Jira US RT-2 for Red Team: "Assessment Config for Multiple Answer Question type". This is a new section for Many Mult Choice questions that enables professors to turn on Full Credit Only functionality or to use the existing Partial Points functionality.
testcase.preconditions: :A DV course must be created with a professor and at least four students enrolled.

step.actions: As a professor, create a new assessment.Manage the assessment.Expand the Configuration tab.
step.expectedresults: There will be a new section above the Save and Cancel buttons titled: "Question Configuration".Under that title will be the value "Multiple Answer".Under Multiple Answer will be a checkbox titled "Full Credit Only" which will be checked by default.Under the checkbox will be a description: "When selected, students must select all the correct answers (and select no incorrect answers) to receive credit." For this new assessment: - The DB value will be "NULL".Uncheck the box and Save. - The new selection will be saved without error. - The DB value will now be "1".Recheck the box and Save. - The new selection will be saved without error. - The DB value will now be "0". Several students will be taking this assessment to verify Full Credit Only functionality when this DB value is equal to "0". Several students will be taking this assessment to verify Full Credit Only functionality when this DB value is equal to "NULL". Several students will be taking this assessment to verify Partial Points functionality (when the DB value is = "1"). The first student is now ready to take the assessments. The student will have gotten 100% (all choices correct) on all assessments. The second student is now ready to take the assessments. For both "Full Credit Only" assessments: - The entire question will be marked incorrect and a score of 0% will be given.For the "Partial Points" assessment: - The choices that SHOULD have been checked will be marked with a green check and each one will have a point value. - The choices that should NOT have been checked will be marked with a red X and no point value given. - The total score will be a partial percentage. The third student is now ready to take the assessments. For both "Full Credit Only" assessments: - The entire question will be marked incorrect and a score of 0% will be given.For the "Partial Points" assessment: - The choices that should NOT have been checked will be marked with a green check and each one will have a point value. - The choices that SHOULD have been checked will be marked with a red X and no point values given. - The total score will be a partial percentage. The fourth student is now ready to take the assessments. The student will have gotten 0% (all choices incorrect) on all assessments. Verify that the expected grade results came through correctly for all assessments and students.

testcase.summary: To ensure that the professor does not see xx.999999999 in Assessment Gradebook Details for an assessment that has MMC question types.All rounded scores should have no more than two decimal places.
testcase.preconditions: :You must have a DV course with a professor and student(s) enrolled.

step.actions: Login as a professor and create an assessment item.
step.expectedresults: The Assessment score (points, not percentage) in Gradebook Details will only be rounded to two decimal places (when rounding is needed). Additionally the point value score in the Gradebook itself will match the score in GBK Details.
